title: Flybe introduces flight switch offer
text:
0 comments Tom Newcombe Mon, 26 Oct 2015 16:13 Follow @thomasnewcombe Flybe has announced that passengers with ‘Get More’ tickets can now change their flights for free on the original day of travel. 
The new initiative means travellers that want to catch an earlier flight on the same day just need to arrive at the airport to check in and will be booked on an alternative flight free of charge, if there is availability. 
To catch a later flight on the same day, passengers will need to contact the Flybe Contact Centre at least one hour before the departure of their original flight booking. They will then rebook the later flight, subject to availability, and a new e-ticket will be issued. 
For day-return journeys, on-the-day changes can be made to the outbound and/or return flight. 
Last month, Flybe called for APD to be scrapped entirely or “dramatically reduced” in an open letter to chancellor George Osborne.
